chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M. Sossaman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE at FTE/Schooling or combination, if not 10 appropriate verifiable job applications per month and 5 hours of community service per week.

Absolute sobriety.
No contact with D.K., L.W., or co-defendant J.W. unless approved by agent.

Counseling and assessments deemed appropriate by agent.
DNA sample & surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

Case called:  2:13 pm
State appears by ADA Amanda Jadin.  Def appears with Atty Kat Jackan.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
Ct 1 (Armed Robbery with Threat of Force-PTAC)>>AMEND to Ct 1 (Theft from Person or Corpse-PTAC-Use of a Dangerous Weapon-943.20(1)(a)
COURT GRANTS
PLEA:
Ct 1 (Theft from Person or Corpse-PTAC-Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>>GUILTY
Ct 2 (Possession of Methamphetamines)>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Deft makes statements.
COURT ORDERS:
Ct 1 (Theft from Person or Corpse-PTAC-Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>>SWH.  Probation for 6 years.  CONDITIONS:  Absolute sobriety, AODA & follow up, counseling and assessments deemed appropriate by agent, no contact with D.K., L.W. or co-deft J.W. unless approved by agent, GFE at FTE/Schooling or combo, if not 10 appropriate verifiable job applications per month and 5 hours community service per week, DNA sample w/surcharge, CC.
Ct 2 (Possession of Methamphetamines)>>SWH.  Probation for 4 years.  CONDITIONS:  Same as setforth above, but also including 6 months conditional MCJ w/Huber for work, child care and treatment. credit for 17 days, if otherwise eligible to be served during the term of supervision but jail to start after 60 days, transfered to county of residence. 

Adj:  2:30 pm

$10,000.00 SIGNATURE WITH FIRST $750.00 CASH (Mother J.R. to co-sign the bond).  Three random drug tests to be done a week at Courage to Change in Abbotsford or ATTIC with results being given to DA's Office and Attorney Jackan - but will only be tested 6 times within a 4 weeks period.  Defendant to go to ATTIC for an evaluation for how many times the Defendant should be tested.  Defendant must be working, confined to Clark and Marathon Counties without prior consent of the Court. No contact with victim(s): D.K. and the co-defendant: J.W. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Absolute sobriety.  No bars, taverns liquor stores or beer tents.  Defendant to submit prescriptions to what medications he is taking.
